macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Mixed as S&P 500 Eases 0.2% from Records, Dow Down 0.8%
items.summary: Wall Street closed lower with the S&P 500 at 6,963.74 (down 0.2%), Dow at 49,191.99 (off 0.8%), and Nasdaq at 23,709.87 (down 0.1%) on January 14, amid softer core inflation and Fed independence headlines. Investors eye upcoming PPI, retail sales, and earnings for rate clues.

items.title: S&P 500 Falls 0.5% to 6,926 in First Back-to-Back Losses of 2026
items.summary: Major indices saw further declines with S&P 500 down 0.5% to 6,926, Dow off 0.09% to 49,149, and Nasdaq slumping 1% to 23,471, pressured by bank earnings misses from Citigroup and Wells Fargo. Tech stocks weakened on reports of China banning Nvidia's H200 AI chips.

items.title: US500 Drops 0.50% to 6929 on January 14 Amid Cooling Labor Data
items.summary: The US500 index fell 0.50% to 6929 points, weighed by cyclical sectors like industrials and financials, while Nasdaq edged up 0.16% on Alphabet's 2.5% rally. JOLTS showed sharp drop in job openings, ADP reported modest hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations.

items.title: Asia Stocks Higher Led by Nikkei Jump of 3.1%, US Economic Optimism Falls
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei 225 surged 3.1% to 53,549.16 and Topix up 2.4%, Hang Seng added 0.7%, while Shanghai slipped 0.7%; US Economic Optimism Index dropped to 47.2 below forecast. VIX rose to 15.98 amid caution ahead of US PPI and retail sales data.

items.title: Bank Earnings Weigh on Financials: Citigroup Down 3.4%, Wells Fargo 5.2%
items.summary: Citigroup and Wells Fargo shares sold off post-earnings, contributing to Dow declines, while oil prices rose 1.4% with WTI at $62.02. Broader market rotation into small caps noted earlier in week with Russell 2000 up 3%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crosses $97,000 for First Time Since November
items.summary: Bitcoin surged past the $97,000 level, trading around $96,896, with forecasts predicting a potential test of support at $94,305 followed by growth toward $106,445 amid a bullish channel.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Predicts Correction to $94,305 Before Rally to $106,445
items.summary: BTC/USD analysis indicates short-term bearish correction testing support near 94,305, with upward rebound expected if support holds, targeting above 106,445; breakdown below 86,205 could lead to 78,045.

items.title: Coinbase Withdraws Support for Clarity Act Over Unfavorable Amendments
items.summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong stated the company cannot back the amended Clarity Act ahead of January 15 Senate markup, calling it worse than status quo, while pledging to fight for better regulations.

items.title: Ripple and Coin Center Back Clarity Act Despite Coinbase Opposition
items.summary: Ripple Labs CEO Brad Garlinghouse and Coin Center's Peter Van Valkenburgh support the Clarity Act, viewing it as a win for crypto, DeFi, and developers ahead of Senate Banking Committee markup.

items.title: Senate Republicans Release CLARITY Act Fact Sheets Ahead of Markup
items.summary: Senate Banking Committee released fact sheets framing the Digital Asset Market CLARITY Act as providing regulatory clarity, protecting developers and self-custody, while targeting centralized intermediaries; markup set for January 15.

items.title: Clarity Act in Focus for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana as Senate Action Looms
items.summary: The Clarity Act could classify Ethereum as a commodity, offering clearer guidance for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Solana developers and investors ahead of Senate markup.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: California Investigates xAI Over Deepfake Pornography Complaints
items.summary: California's Attorney General is probing Elon Musk's xAI after complaints about its AI image tool generating sexual content, potentially violating new deepfake laws like AB 621 effective recently. Experts highlight risks including child exploitation and lack of transparency in xAI's systems.

items.title: Experts Warn Data Guidelines Ignore AI Training, Hindering Competition
items.summary: New digital markets and data protection guidelines fail to address AI training data use, risking unfair advantages for dominant firms and barriers for competitors, according to University of Exeter researchers.

items.title: Safe Pro to Showcase Patented AI Demining Tech at Ukraine Conference
items.summary: Safe Pro Group announced it will present its AI-powered SPOTD platform for detecting explosives via drone imagery at a Kyiv conference on January 15, supporting Ukraine's reconstruction efforts.

items.title: Trump Signs Executive Order for Minimalist National AI Policy
items.summary: On December 11, 2025, President Trump issued an order to maintain U.S. AI dominance via a low-burden framework, including an AI Litigation Task Force to challenge conflicting state laws amid rapid state AI legislation.

items.title: Microsoft Research Explores AI for Scientific Discovery and Health
items.summary: Microsoft's 'On Second Thought' series launches January 15, discussing AI's role in reshaping healthcare and enabling Nobel-scale breakthroughs by helping scientists think differently across chemistry, biology, and physics.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Meta Shuts Down Twisted Pixel, Sanzaru Games, and Armature Studio
items.summary: Meta has closed three VR game studios—Twisted Pixel, Sanzaru Games, and Armature Studio—as part of major job cuts in its Reality Labs division, shifting focus to wearables and third-party developers.

items.title: PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium January 2026 Games Leaked
items.summary: A reliable leaker has revealed the upcoming PS Plus Extra and Premium games for January 2026, set to arrive on January 20, with Resident Evil titles highlighted; official announcement expected soon.

items.title: Arcade Archives Bomb Jack Twin Launches Today
items.summary: HAMSTER Corporation releases Arcade Archives Bomb Jack Twin on Switch and PS4, and Arcade Archives 2 version on Switch 2, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S, priced at $7.99 and $9.99 respectively.

items.title: Solo Dev Game Craftlings Releases Today
items.summary: Ariano GAMES launches its 90s-inspired strategy game Craftlings on January 15, 2026, featuring gather, deliver, build, and fight mechanics.

items.title: Light & Wonder Pays $127.5M to Settle Slot Machine Patent Lawsuit
items.summary: Light & Wonder settles a patent infringement suit with Aristocrat Technologies for $127.5M, agreeing to retire two slot games globally after a former employee's misuse of proprietary math.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Verizon Suffers Major Outage Across the U.S.
items.summary: Verizon is experiencing a significant network outage affecting users on SOS mode nationwide. The disruption was reported on January 14, 2026.

items.title: Big Tech Data Centers Face Growing Community Opposition
items.summary: Tech giants like Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and Meta encounter stiff resistance to billion-dollar data center projects due to local concerns over power, zoning, and environmental impact. Between April and June, 20 proposals worth $98 billion were blocked or delayed in 11 states.

items.title: Highway 1 Along Big Sur Reopens After Closure
items.summary: The iconic Highway 1 along Big Sur in California has reopened, marking a success in infrastructure recovery efforts.

items.title: Meta Overhauls Performance Reviews to Reward Output Over Effort
items.summary: Meta is shifting its employee performance evaluation system to prioritize results rather than effort, adopting approaches similar to Amazon and X.
